explains: n. （建筑物的）正面，立面；假象，伪装

sentences.en: In the evening the facade is floodlit.
sentences.cn: 晚上，建筑物的正面是用泛光灯照明的。

sentences.en: The elaborate facade contrasts strongly with the severity of the interior.
sentences.cn: 精致的门面同室内的简朴形成强烈反差。

sentences.en: The cathedral was eventually completed in 1490, though the Gothic facade remains unfinished.
sentences.cn: 大教堂在1490年终于完工，虽然哥特式的正面仍未建好。
